greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of square root of 6.
comment: Continued fraction expansion is 2 followed by {2, 4} repeated. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 05 2009
Ratio t*o/c where t, o and c are respectively the edge lengths of a tetrahedron, an octahedron and a cube whose areas are the same. See CNRS link. - _Michel Marcus_, Apr 21 2016
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Jason Kimberley, Index of expansions of sqrt(d) in base b
R. J. Nemiroff & J. Bonnell, Plouffe's Inverter, The first 1 million digits of the square root of 6 [Broken link]
R. J. Nemiroff & J. Bonnell, The first 1 million digits of the square root of 6
Ana Rechtman, Avril 2016, 3e défi, Images des Mathématiques, CNRS, 2016.
example: Sqrt(6) = sqrt(1+i*sqrt(3)) + sqrt(1-i*sqrt(3)), where i=sqrt(-1). - _Bruno Berselli_, Nov 20 2012
program: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(6); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b010464.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 01 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
